snippet: The Archdiocese of Boston told priests that they could make changes to church services to prevent the spread of flu, one day after Mayor Thomas M. Menino declared a public health emergency.
abstract: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Boston tells priests they can make changes to church services to prevent the spread of flu; comes one day after Mayor Thomas M Menino declared a public health emergency.
lead_paragraph: The Archdiocese of Boston told priests that they could make changes to church services to prevent the spread of flu, one day after Mayor Thomas M. Menino declared a public health emergency.

headline.main: Massachusetts: Archdiocese Is Guarding Against Flu
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Archdiocese Is Guarding Against Flu
